N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4700.9 - Appeals

State Regulations

Any person whose application to inspect and/or copy records
has been denied pursuant to section
4700.8
of this Part may, within 30
days from the denial, appeal such denial to the executive director of the
authority. Such appeal must be in writing and must set forth the name and
address of the applicant, the specific record(s) requested, the date of the
denial and the reasons given for such denial. The executive director shall, upon receipt of a written appeal, either review the matter and affirm, modify
or reverse the denial or refer it to a three-person Public Records Appeals

Committee who shall review the matter and affirm, modify or reverse the denial. If the decision affirms or modifies the denial, the executive director or the
committee which made the decision, as the case may be, within seven business
days of receipt of the appeal state, in writing, reasons, for such affirmation
or modification, to the person making the appeal and inform such person of his
right to appeal such affirmation or modification under article 78 of the Civil

Practice Law and Rules. The authority shall transmit to the Committee on Public

Access to Records copies of all appeals upon receipt thereof and all
determinations on all appeals within seven business days of receipt of said
appeals to the committee at the address set forth in subdivision (f) of section
1401.7
of this Title, as the same
may from time to time be amended. Notes
